revised_title: The Canonical Artefact and Its Implications for the Emergence of Advanced Intelligence
tldr: The author argues that the existence of a highly intelligent life-form, such as humans, requires a factor of at least 10^264 to be explained. This factor arises from the idea that advanced life-forms would give physical expression to a highly distinguished mathematical truth in a canonical way. The author defines this structure, called the canonical artefact, as a minimal object that bears evidence of advanced intelligence. The article explores the implications of this concept and its potential impact on the understanding of the emergence of advanced life-forms.
